help::ls: to show all files in current directory.
cat: to show the content of a file.
clear: to clear the terminal window.
echo: to display some text on the terminal window.
rm: to remove a certain file. i know what you're thinking..
exit: to close the terminal window.
poweroff: to turn off the machine.
reboot: to restart the machine.
cat::Missing argument: filename (usage example: cat aboutme.txt)

cat about.txt::Hello! I'm Osama Bouzalim, a 19-year-old software developer driven by curiosity and a deep passion for technology. My journey began with a desire to understand how things work behind the scenes—this curiosity led me to explore and eventually fall in love with coding.

I specialize in front-end development using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, where I focus on creating user-friendly interfaces that balance clean design and seamless performance. On the back-end, I use Node.js and Bun to build robust APIs and perform advanced web scraping. Additionally, I leverage Python for scripting, automation, and data manipulation, enjoying the language's flexibility to solve a variety of challenges.

Currently, I'm expanding my horizons by learning Rust, delving into systems programming to deepen my understanding of efficient, high-performance applications. As a lifelong learner, I'm always curious about new tools and technologies, continuously pushing my skill set to new levels. Feel free to explore my work, and don't hesitate to reach out if you'd like to collaborate or discuss a project. Let's build something amazing together!
